dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so there's been some buzz, uh, about Russia's new entry rules, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so there's been some buzz, uh, about Russia's new entry rules, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that. Some outlets are even calling it, like, a "visa regime" now for certain countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, I saw that. Some outlets are even calling it, like, a visa regime now for certain countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Minister of Internal Affairs Yerzhan Sadenov commented on the upcoming changes to Russia™s entry rules, which some media outlets have already dubbed a visa regime.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And that's got Kazakhstan's Minister of Internal Affairs, Yerzhan Sadenov, talking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And that's got Kazakhstan's Minister of Internal Affairs, Yerzhan Sadenov, talking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Minister of Internal Affairs Yerzhan Sadenov commented on the upcoming changes to Russia™s entry rules, which some media outlets have already dubbed a visa regime.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, are they, like, going to hit back with reciprocal measures for Russian citizens? That's what everyone wants to know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, are they, like, going to hit back with reciprocal measures for Russian citizens? That's what everyone wants to know.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he said, and I quote, "Measures are being taken. We are studying international practices. National interests must come first."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he said, and I quote, Measures are being taken. We are studying international practices. National interests must come first.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Measures are being taken. We are studying international practices. National interests must come first, the minister replied.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. "National interests first." That's pretty, um, diplomatic, I guess. But what does that *actually* mean for Russian travelers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. National interests first. That's pretty, um, diplomatic, I guess. But what does that actually mean for Russian travelers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like they're going to look at what other countries do, and also their own laws. But he did stress that foreigners are welcome, *if* they meet legal requirements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like they're going to look at what other countries do, and also their own laws. But he did stress that foreigners are welcome, if they meet legal requirements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He emphasized that when making decisions, the experience of other countries and provisions of national legislation will be taken into account. If a foreigner wants to visit Kazakhstan " they are welcome, provided they meet all the legal requirements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so it's not a full shutdown. But this whole "digital profile" thing Russia's doing for *every* incoming foreigner... that's new.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so it's not a full shutdown. But this whole digital profile thing Russia's doing for every incoming foreigner... that's new.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, a digital profile will be created for every incoming foreigner, including Kazakhs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, even for Kazakhs, apparently. That's been in the works since April, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, even for Kazakhs, apparently. That's been in the works since April, I think.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, in April, Kazakhstani citizens were warned about new rules for entering Russia. Now, a digital profile will be created for every incoming foreigner, including Kazakhs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wild. So they're collecting, like, a lot more data now. It feels like a bigger shift, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild. So they're collecting, like, a lot more data now. It feels like a bigger shift, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It does. But the minister *did* say Kazakhstan has conditions for safe stays, and they're using apps for that already. So they might do something similar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does. But the minister did say Kazakhstan has conditions for safe stays, and they're using apps for that already. So they might do something similar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First of all, we have created all the conditions for the safe stay of foreigners. There are apps in place, they are already functioning. We will implement similar measures, the minister concluded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting. So it's not just a one-way street of changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting. So it's not just a one-way street of changes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. But for now, Kazakh citizens can still enter Russia freely, whether by air or land, despite these new digital profiles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. But for now, Kazakh citizens can still enter Russia freely, whether by air or land, despite these new digital profiles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is noted that Kazakhstani citizens can still enter Russia freely, both via flights from countries with regular passenger air service to Russia and through land border checkpoints.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Good to know. But, um, it definitely signals a new era for cross-border travel in the region, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good to know. But, um, it definitely signals a new era for cross-border travel in the region, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Things are definitely getting, uh, tighter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Things are definitely getting, uh, tighter.
